title: Girl, 10, who has never had a hair cut in her life donates locks to charity
text:

A 10-year-old girl who had never had her haircut in her life has donated her locks to charity after getting it chopped for the first time.

Darlene, from Newquay, finally decided to take the plunge after telling her mum she wanted to share her hair with poorly children.

After thinking it over, she chose to donate her hair to the Little Princess Trust, a UK charity which supplies and funds high-quality wigs made of real hair to children who have hair loss as a result of cancer treatment and other illnesses.

Darlene has had long hair all her life, after her mother never took her to have it cut as a young child, reports Cornwall Live .

At her primary school, she was known for having the longest hair, and on a recent trip to Tokyo, Darlene's family said the local children were mesmerised by her plaited locks, telling Darlene that she looked like the fairy tale character, Rapunzel.

(Image: cornwalllive.com)

Now, Darlene hopes her 51cm donation will be enough to create at least one wig.

Darlene said: "I never really thought about having it cut because I was scared, but then I began thinking about all the poor children who don't have hair.

"It was almost down to my feet so it was pretty long."

Darlene had her hair cut for free at Chocolate Hair Salon on Chester Road in Newquay.

And she loves her new style so much that she's even considering going shorter still.

(Image: cornwalllive.com)

Her proud mum, Devika, said "I think the reason she never had it cut is because initially I didn't cut her hair and then she never wanted it cut.

"She pondered on the idea and said she was ready to have her hair cut but I actually said, 'wait a week, because once it's gone, it's gone'."

She added: "Darlene is a happy, confident child who is always thinking of how she can help others. I am very proud of her for this as it was a huge thing for her to do, as she did love having such long hair.

"Darlene really wants to spread the word of donating hair in the hope that other children would be willing to do the same."
description: Darlene, from Newquay, finally decided to take the plunge after deciding she wanted to help poorly children
